conclusion: Need to analyze the velocity-time graphs for both objects to determine displacement difference.
Graph A shows object A has a constant velocity throughout the time interval from 0 to t1.
Graph B shows object B has a constant velocity at the beginning of the time interval, but then experiences a decrease in velocity.
Displacement is the change in position of an object.
For object A, the displacement is constant since its velocity is constant.
For object B, the displacement is not constant because its velocity decreases over time.
The difference in displacement between object A and object B is the change in position of object B from the initial position to the final position.
Since object B's velocity decreases over time, its final position will be less than its initial position.
The difference in displacement between object A and object B will be continuously increasing.
Yes, the difference in displacement between the two objects, A and B, is necessarily continuously increasing during the time interval from 0 to t1.
